description: The `synthetic.job_applicants` table represents information about individuals applying for jobs, capturing their personal details and application information. Key columns include the primary key `applicant_id`, personal identifiers like `first_name`, `last_name`, and contact information such as `email` and `phone`, along with URLs for their `resume` and `linkedin` profiles, indicating a comprehensive record for each applicant. This table functions as a standalone entity in the data model, given it has no foreign key relationships, suggesting it centralizes applicant data without direct association to other tables.

columns.name: applicant_id
columns.description: This column represents a unique identifier assigned to each person applying for a job, ensuring each applicant is distinctly recognized within the system. This sequential numbering aids in tracking and managing job applications effectively.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: This column represents the given names of individuals who have applied for a job. Each entry corresponds to the first name of a job applicant in the database.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: This column represents the family surnames of individuals applying for jobs. The values are commonly recognized last names.

columns.name: email
columns.description: This column represents the email addresses of individuals applying for job positions. Each entry is a unique contact detail for communication with a job applicant.

columns.name: phone
columns.description: This column contains contact phone numbers for job applicants. The numbers are presented in various formats, including international dialing codes and extensions.

columns.name: resume_url
columns.description: This column stores the web addresses where job applicants have uploaded their resumes. Each URL provided gives access to an applicant's resume hosted on a personal or business website.

columns.name: linkedin_url
columns.description: This column contains URLs that appear to represent personal or business websites for job applicants, rather than containing direct links to LinkedIn profiles. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: source
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. The sample values appear to be nonsensical and do not provide clear insight into the business meaning of this column.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when an application was created in the system. Purpose unclear from available data as it lacks a detailed description or variety in sample values.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column indicates the most recent date and time when a record for a job applicant was updated. It is useful for tracking changes or modifications made to applicant data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX job_applicants_pkey ON synthetic.job_applicants USING btree (applicant_id)
